6$Condition: Mania associated with Bipolar Disorder$11/7/2016 1:49:46 PM$Reviewer: tomar54, 55-64 Male  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient) $2$1$3$Caused constant tremors. The worst side effect was the rapid weight gain. I was used to some weight gain from other meds I had used, but on divalproex I gained 40 lbs. in 2 months, then herniated a disc while exercising to take off the weight. Spent two years with back doctors, meanwhile my weight ballooned. I went from 200 (already overweight) to 275. At 275 I developed hight blood pressure, heart disease, rashes, lung problems, and my back pain was excruciating and constant. I stopped taking Divalproex, started a number of heart meds, and my cardiologist supervised a diet, and now I am down to 170. I will always have a bad back now, but it is better than it was. I still have the heart issues, but blood pressure is under control with medication. I am struggling to control my Bi-Polar II without medication, but this was definitely a case of the cure being worse than the disease. I wish I had never been on Divalproex. It nearly killed me, didn't help all that much anyway, and I will suffer the residual health problems the rest of my life.
7$Condition: Bipolar Depression$10/10/2016 9:26:24 AM$Reviewer: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient) $3$1$2$Does this medicine cause loss of sexual drive?
8$Condition: Bipolar Depression$8/25/2016 8:27:16 PM$Reviewer: Anish1979 , 35-44 on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient) $4$5$4$I was misdiagnosed for over 15 years with docs always saying it was just depression. I have bipolar with depression, anxiety, ADHD, agoraphobia, and on top of all that Fibromyalgia. When I was finally diagnosed with bipolar disorder my doc tried many different meds, but I had severe reactions to all of them. The first med that worked was Lithium. I got my labs done and never had too much in my blood, but ended up losing over half my hair and gaining over 100 pounds! I weaned myself off of the Lithium and doc put me on Depakote/Divalprox ER. I lost 140 pounds in 6 months and got all my hair back. I take Cymbals, Valium, Ritalin, and Gabapentin as well. I felt like a new person, mild depression, mood swings much better, and rage/psycho feeling episodes were better. I have had to teach myself to avoid confrontations and other situations though. Grogginess in morning has always been there, could be meds for Fibromyalgia. Overall this mixture of meds has been a lifesaver! I am so glad to not feel like a lab rat anymore!

31$Condition: Bipolar Depression$1/8/2014 12:16:19 AM$Reviewer: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient) $5$5$5$Divalproex is the third bipolar med I've tried, and it's the first that doesn't feel like a complete waste of money. I do get some slight tremors after my morning dose, but that's the only side effect I've experienced (my liver function's actually improved since I switched from lithium). There's a definite difference in my mood, too -- I'm far less irritable and edgy on divalproex than I felt on lithium or Lamictal, and it works fast enough to help prevent my bad moods from escalating.

117$Condition: Migraine Prevention$3/15/2009 11:33:04 PM$Reviewer: umcanes
column2: 25-34 Male  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient) $4$3$5$"Been on this for over 2 years (minus 1 month) the Depakote ER version (The brand name one).

column1: I had really bad migraines with aura (including tingling in left arm
column2: left leg tightness
column3: periods of lethargy/inability
column4: mood swings
column5: bright colors
column6: sensitivity to light
column7: ""sinus"" pain
column8: followed by a moderate headache...total disruption of my life
column9: I had even just moved and started a new job (luckily not much was expected of me at work when I started).

column1: Tried Topamax for a month
column2: did not relieve aura symptoms and cause terrible insomnia and was giving me terrible side effects.

column1: Switched away from stubborn doc
column2: went to specialist
column3: had MRI
column4: EEG
column5: and other test to make sure of the diagnosis
column6: and was prescribed this (500mg/day)
column7: worked within a few days. I was back to my normal self.

column1: No aura symptoms
column2: and greatly controlled headache pain (only occasional ""sinus pain"" caused by migraine remained). I was prescribed amitryptiline 25 mg/day for this pain and IBS burning
column3: I only take it occasionally not regularly.

column1: The low dose of amitryptiline seemed to augment the positive effects of the Depakote (at first would have some very minor prickling or stinging paid from the combo
column2: but it went away in a month and wasn't a problem).

column1: I get a rash 8 hours after I put on sunscreen
column2: but I think this happened once before when I wasn't even taking Depakote (I wasn't taking anything as a recall).

column1: No noticeable side effects from Depakote at first.
I gained 20 lbs over a year
column2: but it might've been from my thyroid being underactive (this was found later on
column3: and is not necessarily related to the depakote according to my doctor). Also might've been because my appetite returned because I was feeling healthy again.

column1: The insomnia I experienced from Topamax disappeared after switching to this. However
column2: I have not tried the new generic
column3: and my insurance is forcing to do the generic the next time I refill."

column1: 132$Condition: Migraine Prevention$1/8/2020 11:46:37 AM$Reviewer: Clemmie
column2: 55-64 on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient) $4$4$4$I have been suffering from morning headaches every day for 2.5 months.This resulted in taking my maxalt/rizatriptan every day to stop the pain and prevent full blown migraine from kicking in. Then I started having side effects from the maxalt since I was taking it so often. I have used maxalt for over 20 years for occasional migraine prevention. Taking it every day concerned me. My neuro PA tried several treatments for me
column3: and the last time I saw him prescribed depakote.  I took one (250 mg) pill at bedtime since it can cause drowsiness. He advised I work up to one pill in the morning and one at night once my body adjusted to it. THE NEXT MORNING after my first pill
column4: I woke up headache-free.  I have only had to take maxalt twice in the last month; probably because I drank alcohol a few times which can sometimes lead to a headache. They were not morning headaches. I am thrilled with this drug! No more 3-4am headaches waking me up requiring me to medicate. I never upped my dose to the am pill one since it seems to be working with just one at night. I'm going to go back to review my progress with my PA. I am not crazy about the side effects I have read about
column5: but so far I haven't noticed anything but some back pain. I'm curious how long I will be on this drug.  For me
column6: at this time
column7: it has been very effective in giving me my head back pain-free.  I'm a fan.

column1: 149$Condition: Migraine Prevention$10/9/2016 4:09:12 PM$Reviewer: migrainenomore
column2: 35-44 Male  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient) $5$5$5$"It'd be hard for me to be more satisfied with this medication.  I have suffered from Migraine for 20 years until I started a 250mg twice daily dose of Depakote.  Despite getting them twice monthly
column3: I have not had a Migraine headache since.

column1: I have also had no unsatisfactory side-effects from this medication.  The two ""side-effects"" I *have* experienced have been a dramatic reduction in the amount of anxiety I experience and a strange effect that has made consuming alcohol unenjoyable.  My alcohol consumption prior to Depakote was very occasional but alcohol generally made me feel more relaxed or had a positive effect on my mood.  While taking Depakote
column2: if I drink enough to feel the effects of alcohol (about a half of a glass of wine)
column3: it is accompanied by minor depression.  I no longer consume any alcohol as a result and since I wasn't much of a drinker to begin with
column4: this has been totally acceptable.

column1: I used to get Migraine episodes twice monthy
column2: peeking in September and April at sometimes weekly. Episodes would last for about 3-days of intense pain
column3: with aura and nausea followed by one day of listlessness (though no emotional depression).  I have not had one single episode since starting this medication and have been taking it for two years without incident.  This medication -- costing under $5/month -- has *completely* changed my life
column4: reducing my anxiety not just by the medications direct effects but the indirect effect of not having to worry if I'll have a sudden
column5: unexpected
column6: horrible pain in my skull.  I couldn't be more grateful."

column3: like most seizure medications it caused his hair to fall out.

column1: I would recommend this medicine to anyone having seizures in spite of the side effects because it causes seizures to completely stop. Depakote causes people to be seizure free. As long as they take the medication of course. Some people have to take this for a lifetime but they are willing to do that to be seizure free. The only problem I have with it is that my hair is falling out in clumps. I read the warnings but didn't listen to them much. My hair is my baby and was very long and was as thick as a half dollar but after 3 months on this medication my hair started falling out. Now 6 months later it is as thick as a quarter. column2: 35-44 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient) $1$1$1$"I was given Depakote in the ER of Queens Med. Ctr. in Honolulu. I was given two doses of Depakote intravenously against my will. (stupidly I signed some release that took my rights away)I guess my not falling after the first
column3: prompted that particular doctor (Dr. Matias) to give me another dose against my will. 18-24hrs later I had a reaction to whatever they gave me in the ER of QMC. It amounted to what I can only describe as a ""Joker"" face
column4: yes from Batman with Michael Keaton. I know it was Depakote
column5: but they tried to lie and say the first dose was something different. So I had a huge smile on my face
column6: that wouldn't go away. This troubled the nurses and doctors who were providing my care
column7: and they rushed to get something to counteract what the ER of QMC had given me. They weren't even sure what the ER gave me
column8: but they knew something was wrong. I didn't feel like anything was wrong
column9: my face was just cramped up in a smile. I could breathe and talk and walk. I just couldn't relax my face. To be honest I don't even know what was going on
column10: I am not a doctor. I believe what ever they gave me worked
column11: because my smile relaxed and I was able to get some rest. But if you asked me to tell you what they gave me
column12: I couldn't for sure this or that. I felt like I was mistreated by the Queens Medical Center's ER
column13: I feel like I was lied to
column14: poked and prodded. The most important thing is I was saying the whole time ""I don't want anything
column16: I DON'T WANT IT!"" Somehow they still had the power to do it
column17: Lucky I am still here Matias

Like peeing all night so couldn't get but 2-3 hours solid sleep dr prescribed med to help bladder control and sleeper instead of getting off lithium. none of the other meds worked by the way.  so the last 4 years very sleep deprived. you can imagine what that does to a persons mood and personality let alone being bipolar.fatigue, muscle aches , hair loss all from lithium.  Maybe a little thinning so far from the depakote, hard to tell but being a woman it's not a real plus.  by the way my dr wanted me to continue on the lithium even though my thyroid got way out of wack  and I kept saying something was prompting me to get off of it onto something different.  so i had to be my own patient advocate and push.  just remember your dr is not god, talk to others, get a second opinion if needed, bring someone with to appointments.

252$Condition: Epileptic Seizure$7/20/2012 2:17:02 PM$Reviewer: SkerJames, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient) $4$3$4$I was diagnosed with juvenile myoclonic epilepsy at the age of 17 and started taking 250 mg of Depakote ER 3x day. After some issues with my menstrual cycle
column2: my medication was briefly switched to phenobarbital (briefly due to the fact that I had severe mood swings and nausea) before switching back to Depakote. After starting college
column3: I began to wake up dizzy
column4: my neurologist believed I was having seizures in my sleep and the dosage of my medicine was increased to 500 mg 2x day. For several years
column5: the dosage remained the same.  Over the last three years
column6: though
column7: I have begun to experience tonic-clonic seizures so the dosage is now 750 mg 2x a day. I feel tired and generally lethargic most of the time. Rarely do I ever feel energized. Over the last 14 years
column8: I have noticed a decrease in my memory
column9: but I don't know if it's side effects of the medication
column10: epilepsy or both. My neurologist has me take folic acid supplement in case I become pregnant and Vitamin D with Calcium supplements to prevent bone thinning. As long as I take my medication REGULARLY (I set an alarm on my cell phone so I always remember to take it exactly 12 hours apart)
column11: my seizures appear to be well-controlled although I have had two in the last six months. Those episodes coupled with the general side effects have led me to contemplate switching medications yet I'm afraid that's a ""grass is greener on the other side"" approach and will do more harm than good.  "

column1:
267$Condition: Bipolar Depression$2/13/2012 7:56:29 AM$Reviewer: Julie, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient) $5$4$3$I have been taking Depakote for approx 2 years. At first I took Depakote in the morning, which resulted in me not being able to function during the day.I discussed this with my psychiatrist who advised me to take my medication before going to bed.This has worked well, I sleep better and funtion ok during the day - sometimes feeling a little tired.I take Depakote, Fluoxetine and sometimes Propanolol for anxiety.Depakote suits me and my mind is very much calmer with no racing thoughts and I am more able to keep things in perspective.I am now able to get myself to the gym - which helps greatly with my moods.I would recommend Depakote, but,I do appreciate that what I have read in other reviews that it is definitely not for every one.I began to begin feeling the benefits of Depakote a month after starting it.I no longer get crazy mood swings, so for me this drug works well - although I am concerned about its toxicity levels etc.Now that I am feeling more balanced I combine my drugs with eating healthily and getting lots of excercise.This is a massive improvement as I used to suffer from low self esteem and lack of confidence. I hope that if you try Depakote that it works as well for you as  it has for me. I now have far more good days than bad.
268$Condition: Bipolar Depression$1/28/2012 12:21:34 AM$Reviewer: Ms. Edington, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient) $2$1$5$I have Been on Depekote since 2007. Found out recently that I've lost some of my memory, have many nervous system issues and as of yesterday my ammonia levels in my blood are toxic from the medication. For mentally stability the medication is a great help however there are risk. I was told I was to have an MRI and EEG done as well to see what kind of damage has been done to the brain from possible swelling. Do you research. If your on the medication please make sure your doctor is ordering all the proper blood work and note that ammonia levels must be put on ice to get a correct reading. 
269$Condition: Epileptic Seizure$1/26/2012 11:00:17 AM$Reviewer: Kelly H, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient) $3$1$3$I just got off Depakote after 15 years, and thank God I did.  I felt like there was a veil between me and the rest of the world.  I was depressed, clutzy, couldn't remember anything, and constantly making mistakes.
270$Condition: Epileptic Seizure$1/25/2012 8:13:18 PM$Reviewer: Edgy , 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient) $2$1$3$After every other medication tried didn't work on me, Depakote was administered and some results were gained. However, if anything happened in my schedule to throw me off just a little bit, I would have 2-3 seizures a day for about a week. I took this drug from age 8-15 and still have epilepsy to this day but now I don't use medication because of what Depakote did to me. I don't remember my childhood and it wasn't that long ago. I do remember the faces of family members, or what food I have eaten today. I gained 100 pounds while on this drug and within three months of getting off of it, I lost 80 pounds. I have had vicious mood swings since day one and still have them today. A very large part of me feels that Depakote has actually been a worse part of my life than the epilepsy that doesn't want to go away. Yes it stopped the seizures most of the time, but when it didn't, they were many times worse. If there are any other medications out there that you are able to take and results would be gained, I STRONGLY recommend that you do so. Depakote took away my childhood and forced me to grow up at the ripe old age of 8.

column2: 45-54 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient) $4$4$3$"I started taking this drug 6 weeks ago.  I was ready for weight gain
column3: but the opposite has happened.  I no longer find myself craving fatty
column4: starchy
column5: fried foods.

column1: The other side effect that I was shocked to have is a marked increase in my libido.  I feel like a 20 year old.

I do not like feeling so drowsy.  It has slowed down my overall system so much.  I can't get up and going until about 2pm or later.  For years I was up and out of bed by 7am or earlier.  I am considering reintroducing caffeine to my diet.  With years of anxiety
column2: I stopped using caffeine.  Now with this medication
column3: I'm thinking that maybe a little will help me to get going earlier in the day.

column1: Also it has my slowed my GI system.  I'm not constipated
column2: I just am not as ""regular"" as I was prior to the drug.  I'm taking fiber supplement and eating tons of veggies/fruit to combat this side effect.

column1: It's helped with my terrible anger problems.  I'm not nearly as obnoxious on the road as I used to be.
It amazes me at how different every one's response to Depakote is.  It just goes to show that we're all unique.
I feel very lucky to have found this medication.  I just hope I can combat the drowsiness and GI problems."

column2: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Caregiver) $1$1$4$My 15 year old son was prescribed Depakote foe bipolar depression after spending 5 days in a behavioral health facility and released from the facility after two days on the medication regardless of my strong concerns of him behaving unlike I had ever seen the night before.  Three days later he was throwing up ever hour for 10 hours and we went to the emergency room.  He was given two IV and his blood tests came up with abnormal liver function.  He was sent home and retested two days later and his range was 6248 - under 100 being normal.  We saw a pediatric specialist today and his liver is swollen two times the normal size and he had additional blood tests and if the levels have not gone down he will be admitted inpatient today.  I will find out in one hour.  I wanted to post and make sure anyone who uses this drug takes extreme caution of the liver.

column2: 55-64 Male  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient) $5$2$5$"For 17 years
column3: totally controlled my simple
column4: partial seizure disorder
column5: which I was diagnosed with at age 43
column6: although I had been having them (approx. 1 every 4 months) since age 13. Took 1
column7: 000 mg/day. No observable side-effects except about 10 lb. weight gain. However
column8: about a year ago
column9: I read an article in the popular press about Depakote causing bone thinning. Neither my PCP or neurologist had mentioned this (perhaps because I am a male.) Searching the Internet
column10: I found a number of studies in journals such as Neurology
column11: dating from about 2001
column12: establishing a like between Depakote and osteoporosis.

column1: I asked for a bone scan and
column2: sure enough
column3: had osteoporosis
column4: even though I had none of the risk factors. I had no family history
column5: have run for 30 years (weight-bearing exercise strengthens bones)
column6: and took calcium supplements.

column1: I have gotten off Depakote.
Anyone taking Depakote for extended periods of time
column2: in my opinion
column3: should have regular bone scan
column4: one at least every three years. At least one study showed that bone thinning began in as little as one year of use.

column1: I am very surprised that information
column2: like the product labeling
column3: about the side-effects of Depakote rarely mention bone-thinning (WebMD being an exception)."

column1: 450$Condition: Bipolar I Disorder with Most Recent Episode Mixed$3/2/2010 2:57:28 AM$Reviewer: Moi
column2: Male  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient) $1$1$1$I was on this drug for quite a few years as a child and teenager. It didn't solve any problems but in my case it caused muscular degeneration. When I complained about how weak I felt
column3: the Doctors attributed it to symptoms of the Bipolar and didn't take me seriously. It progressed into bed wetting problems
column4: as I no longer had enough muscle control to control my bladder. When I was 18 the damage was so bad I suffered from asthma. I finally had enough
column5: and took myself off medications all together in October of 2002. I hoarded the medications
column6: waiting for a doctor note to show improvement was noted. Once I had it
column7: I told him I wasn't taking medications and successfully forced him to concede that in my case they were causing most of my problems. It has been over 7 years since I have been on drugs. I still have symptoms of Bipolar
column8: but I control it with Meditation. Not Medication. But the muscular degeneration was so bad that I still suffer some of the damage. I only last year recovered controller of my bladder
column9: and this year I am getting back muscle tone around my body. As far as I am concerned
column10: if I continued taking this drug I would be dead now. Instead
column11: I am a home owner with a perfect credit score and I lead a productive and full filling life. I just learned to create goals for myself as a way of dealing with the depression
column12: and use common sense for dealing with the anxiety. No one should take this drug if you feel yourself getting weak.

THEY DID TAKE ME OFF THE DRUG AND I LOST 110 LBS IN 10 MONTHS.  I DEFLATED JUST AS I HAD INFLATED ON THE DRUG.  BUT
column7: AFTER 3 YEARS OF TRYING OTHER MEDICINES
column8: LOSING MY JOB AND DAMN NEAR LOSING MY MIND
column9: I WENT BACK TO THE DEPAKOTE
column10: AND GLADLY.  THE DRUG WORKS FOR ME
column11: WITH THE EXCEPTION OF THE WEIGHT GAIN
column13: IN A YEAR I BALLOONED AGAIN AND AM NOW AT 270 LBS.  BUT
column14: I HAVE MY MIND AND AM FUNCTIONAL AGAIN.  I HAVE TAKEN THE ATTITUDE OF
column15: IT'S THE QUALITY OF LIFE NOT THE QUANTITY.  SO
column16: IF MY OTHER HEALTH ISSUES CUT MY LIFE SHORT
column17: AT LEAST I AM ABLE TO FUNCTION IN EVERY DAY LIFE.  TO THOSE OF YOU WHO ARE NOT FULLY PLEASED WITH THIS DRUG
column18: GIVE IT A CHANCE AND RESPECT IT AS I HAVE HAD TO. - SIGNED

column1: 561$Condition: Manic-Depression$5/21/2009 12:58:01 PM$Reviewer: Mom
column2: 75 or over Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Caregiver) $4$4$4$"My Mom is 92 years old. She lives in a retirement community with a level 2 condition of care (not assisted or Altzheimers). She is outgoing
column3: walks slowly with a three wheeler and has a smile most of the time.

column1: Mos was given Depakote while at a local hospital for treatment of a ""near collapse condition"" with low blood pressure
column2: gastointestinal infection   and heart irregularities.

column1: She was treated successfully over about 10 days and released back to her senior living residence.
At the dinner table she quickly became agitated
column2: yelling out her name continually. She was also counting repeatedly and with determination. She was usually calm and peaceful before all of this reaction.

column1: It turns out that the hospital had been giving her Depakote successfully. The residence nurse and manager did not track with that and the  Depakote  was mistakenly not continued. We
column2: the family
column3: discovered the error by a tip and notified the management who quickly restored the Depakote. Mom's condition improved like a miracle.  She is still on a mild dose and is loving and cheerful again.

column1: Be cautious of long term dosages.
Craig Beam
column2: son

column1: 595$Condition: Petit Mal Epilepsy with Multiple Seizure Types$3/15/2009 1:52:58 AM$Reviewer: findacure
column2: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Caregiver) $1$1$4$"THIS DRUG IS DANGEROUS AND MAY CAUSE DEATH!!

column1: My father has been taking Depakote for 7 years
column2: and I believe that it has given him Parkenson's Disease. The side effects listed on the warning label are identical to those of Parkenson's. When he began taking Depakote
column3: he immediately had severely debilitating side effects. He had no energy
column4: severe muscle weakness
column5: dizzyness
column6: and has not been able to do much except for sleep and sit in a chair all day. His muscles have almost completely atrophied and he is in a rehabilitation center trying to get enough strength in his muscles to be able to walk again. Right now
column7: as a result of this medication
column8: he is at the end stages of Parkenson's
column9: which eventually results in death. Luckily
column10: I figured out that he doesn't actually need to be taking any anti-convulsants at all
column11: because he has been seizure free for 5 years now. I believe that his seizures were caused by a heart condition that he was diagnosed with 5 years ago called Atrial Fibrillation. We are now tapering him off of Depakote
column12: (even though his doctor would not agree to it)and after only 3 weeks of a decrease in medication(from 1000mg/day to 750mg/day)in combination with physical therapy
column13: my father's Parkenson's symptoms are actually reversing! Six weeks ago
column14: we thought were going to loose him. His energy
column15: strength and balance are now returning to him
column16: and he is making remarkable strides on his road to recovery. My only advice to those with epilepsy is to find the cause
column17: and treat from there. Seizures are a major warning sign that something is wrong. Medications  may control the episodes in the meantime
column18: but in the long term you end up toxifying the body. Those toxins then buildup in your nervous system
column19: and cause it to deteriorate. Meanwhile
column20: your ""alarm system"" isn't going off anymore
column21: and now you are headed for even more serious danger. You will have better luck curing the seizures if you find the cause and treat from there. Those w/nervous system problems should detox."

608$Condition: Epileptic Seizure$2/23/2009 1:45:50 AM$Reviewer: west_price, 25-34 Male  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient) $4$4$5$I was prescribed 1000mg per day, but generally I have taken 500mg because I don't like the side effects. The medicine caused bad facial break-outs for about 4 years, but those stopped after I used proactiv, and then they generally stopped without it. I also gained weight for a couple of years-I'm thin anyway so it wasn't a terrible problem-but I am back to my normal weight now. My seizures were caused by a head injury in 2001, and I was having significant numbers of grand mal seizures after the injury. Depakote usually controls my seizures, but I still generally have 1 or 2 per year. I have had 6 seizures in the last year, and I am probably going to take my full 1000mg per day, but there are some mental and physical side effects-it is hard to decide if I should take my full dosage and I am having money problems so it is hard to see my doctor to discuss this with him (I am currently on the patient assistance program.) I can say that I was taking effexor that controlled my panic disorder, and the increased seizures started after I began taking that medication. I am currently not taking it because while it did stop my panic attacks, there were the increased seizures, and sexual side effects that the effexor had on me.

column1: 746$Condition: Bipolar Depression$4/1/2008 9:14:37 PM$Reviewer: mamatee
column2: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Caregiver) $4$4$3$My 72 year old mother has been treated with different drugs for her bi-polar symptoms for the past 3 years.  All of the side effects from previous drugs made it harder to deal with than bi-polar itself.  Her doctor then had her start depakote last fall and she did well for a month and half so he doubled it..not sure why. Then she started having the shakes real bad and would be dizzy and stmbled into to things. We were so worried she would break a hip. The doctor pulled her off of it for a couple weeks then started her back to original dose and she's do better. She still tends to feel a little loopy from the meds...but we all agree (her included) that is better than the ups and downs of bi-polar. Treating any depression is so tricky as everyone's body chemistry is different. It takes patience and love and a very good support system for folks suffering.  God bless anyone who has a loved one or is dealing with this themselves.

column2: 35-44 Male  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient) $5$3$5$"Presented with extreme manic episode at age 40 and initially misdiagnosed as schizoform and put on Zyprexa with good result. After 1 1/2 years I moved out of state
column3: was rediagnosed Bipolar
column4: and with reservation was switched to Depakote with an antidepressant (Olanzapine).

column1: I've experienced good results after 2 years of treatment with Depakote. The side effects are somewhat troubling (i.e. listlessness and weight gain)
column2: however the alternative
column3: a recurrance of an extreme manic episode
column4: vastly 'outweights' (pun intended) these effects. My biggest concern with the medication is that I do feel a significant suppression of my creative side.

column1: ALWAYS take your meds as prescribed!!!"

I am a rapid cycling bipolar (minutes not days and hours) I have noticed increased appetite
column3: sex drive and enjoy time with my family that I have not had in 36 years of my life. I am calm
column4: collected and NOT exhausted from my mania. Also

column6: it isn't just the ""appropriate response"". This includes the smiling and the crying. I am no longer in the ""fog"" of BP but a REAL person with REAL reactions. I would take the side effects and risks to remain this way. I am a person for the first time in my life.
